panels.description:
Actual bare-metal CPU usage. Requires Node Exporter.

Source: node_exporter on the hypervisor (kernel-reported host metrics).
Limitations: Host-level view (not per-VM). Memory includes cache/buffers behavior; filesystem usage can differ due to mount options and reserved space; short windows can be noisy if scrapes are delayed.
panels.title: Physical Host CPU Saturation | H:

panels.description:
Actual used memory (Total - Available). Requires Node Exporter.

Source: node_exporter on the hypervisor (kernel-reported host metrics).
Limitations: Host-level view (not per-VM). Memory includes cache/buffers behavior; filesystem usage can differ due to mount options and reserved space; short windows can be noisy if scrapes are delayed.
panels.title: Physical Host RAM Usage | H:

panels.description:
System load average. High load with low CPU usage suggests I/O wait. Requires Node Exporter.

Source: node_exporter on the hypervisor (kernel-reported host metrics).
Limitations: Host-level view (not per-VM). Memory includes cache/buffers behavior; filesystem usage can differ due to mount options and reserved space; short windows can be noisy if scrapes are delayed.
panels.title: Physical Host Load Average (15m) | H:

panels.description:
Used space on the root mount. If this fills up, the hypervisor may crash. Requires Node Exporter.

Source: node_exporter on the hypervisor (kernel-reported host metrics).
Limitations: Host-level view (not per-VM). Memory includes cache/buffers behavior; filesystem usage can differ due to mount options and reserved space; short windows can be noisy if scrapes are delayed.
panels.title: Physical Host Root FileSystem Usage | H:

panels.description:
Dropped packets or hardware errors on physical interfaces. If this line moves, checking cabling, switch ports, or MTU.

Source: node_exporter on the hypervisor (kernel-reported host metrics).
Limitations: Host-level view (not per-VM). Memory includes cache/buffers behavior; filesystem usage can differ due to mount options and reserved space; short windows can be noisy if scrapes are delayed.
panels.title: Physical Host Interface Drops & Errors | H:

panels.description:
Number of times the Linux Kernel killed a process due to Out Of Memory. Should be ZERO.

Source: node_exporter on the hypervisor (kernel-reported host metrics).
Limitations: Host-level view (not per-VM). Memory includes cache/buffers behavior; filesystem usage can differ due to mount options and reserved space; short windows can be noisy if scrapes are delayed.
panels.title: Physical Host OOM Kills (Last 1h) | H:

panels.description:
Hypervisor CPU Commit: active Nova vCPUs divided by host CPU threads. 100% = 1:1 commit; values >100% indicate overcommit.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Hypervisor CPU Commit | H:

panels.description:
Total active Nova vCPUs scheduled on each hypervisor.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Hypervisor vCPU Allocation | H:

panels.description:
Breakdown of CPU usage on the Hypervisor. 'VM Workload' shows cycles consumed by guests. 'System Overhead' is the remainder of the total host load, indicating OVS, Storage, or Kernel pressure.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Hypervisor CPU Composition | H:

panels.description:
Aggregate VM Stall (Steal + Wait) across all instances on the hypervisor. This indicates total 'pain' or contention experienced by guests.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Aggregate VM Stall (Steal/Wait) | H:

panels.description:
Remaining host memory available for scheduling new VMs (Total Host RAM - Allocated VM RAM). This is the 'Nova Scheduler' view of capacity, distinct from physical free memory. Does not account for nova.conf reserve.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. RAM allocation is provisioned/configured (scheduler/accounting), not guest 'used'. Clouds may overcommit RAM (e.g., allocation ratios), and this excludes some host overhead.
panels.title: Scheduling Capacity (Unallocated RAM)

panels.description:
Percentage of each hypervisorâ€™s total host RAM currently used by its instances (guest memory used vs host capacity).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Memory 'used' here is hypervisor-observed usage (not the guest OS free/used breakdown) and can be affected by ballooning and QEMU overhead.
panels.title: Hypervisor Live Instance Memory vs Host Capacity | H:

panels.description:
RAM commit per hypervisor: total instance-allocated RAM divided by host RAM capacity. >100% indicates overcommit.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. RAM allocation is provisioned/configured (scheduler/accounting), not guest 'used'. Clouds may overcommit RAM (e.g., allocation ratios), and this excludes some host overhead.
panels.title: Hypervisor Ram Commit | H:

panels.description:
Total instance-allocated guest RAM (MB) per hypervisor.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. RAM allocation is provisioned/configured (scheduler/accounting), not guest 'used'. Clouds may overcommit RAM (e.g., allocation ratios), and this excludes some host overhead.
panels.title: Hypervisor Allocated Instance Memory (MB) | H:

panels.description:
For each hypervisor, percentage of instance memory actually used versus memory allocated to those instances (guest view).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. RAM allocation is provisioned/configured (scheduler/accounting), not guest 'used'. Clouds may overcommit RAM (e.g., allocation ratios), and this excludes some host overhead. Memory 'used' here is hypervisor-observed usage (not the guest OS free/used breakdown) and can be affected by ballooning and QEMU overhead.
panels.title: Hypervisor Live Instance Ram Use vs Instance Allocation | H:

panels.description:
Total guest-view RAM in use (MB) by all instances on each hypervisor.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Memory 'used' here is hypervisor-observed usage (not the guest OS free/used breakdown) and can be affected by ballooning and QEMU overhead.
panels.title: Hypervisor Live Instance Memory (MB) | H:

panels.description:
Per-hypervisor disk read throughput sourced from instances (guest reads summed at the hypervisor).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk I/O counters are cumulative and typically visualized as rates; they may not include backend replication/cluster overhead.
panels.title: Hypervisor Instance Disk Read Throughput | H:

panels.description:
Per-hypervisor disk write throughput sourced from instances (guest writes summed at the hypervisor).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk I/O counters are cumulative and typically visualized as rates; they may not include backend replication/cluster overhead.
panels.title: Hypervisor Instance Disk Write Throughput | H:

panels.description:
Per-hypervisor cumulative disk reads over the time window (guest reads summed at the hypervisor).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk I/O counters are cumulative and typically visualized as rates; they may not include backend replication/cluster overhead.
panels.title: Hypervisor Instance Disk Read Total | H:

panels.description:
Per-hypervisor cumulative disk writes over the time window (guest writes summed at the hypervisor).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk I/O counters are cumulative and typically visualized as rates; they may not include backend replication/cluster overhead.
panels.title: Hypervisor Instance Disk Write Total | H:

panels.description:
Per-hypervisor disk read IOPS (guest read operations summed at the hypervisor).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk I/O counters are cumulative and typically visualized as rates; they may not include backend replication/cluster overhead.
panels.title: Hypervisor Instance Disk Read IOPS | H:

panels.description:
Per-hypervisor disk write IOPS (guest write operations summed at the hypervisor).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk I/O counters are cumulative and typically visualized as rates; they may not include backend replication/cluster overhead.
panels.title: Hypervisor Instance Disk Write IOPS | H:

panels.description:
Average disk latency (seconds per operation) aggregated at the hypervisor level for Read, Write, and Flush operations.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk I/O counters are cumulative and typically visualized as rates; they may not include backend replication/cluster overhead.
panels.title: Hypervisor Instance Disk Latency (Avg) | H:

panels.description:
Aggregate Flush IOPS vs Write IOPS at the hypervisor level. High flush rates relative to writes indicate metadata-heavy or sync-heavy workloads.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk I/O counters are cumulative and typically visualized as rates; they may not include backend replication/cluster overhead.
panels.title: Hypervisor Instance Flush vs Write Pattern | H:

panels.description:
Per-hypervisor aggregate RX packet rate sourced from instances.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Hypervisor Instance Network RX Packets per Second | H:

panels.description:
Per-hypervisor aggregate TX packet rate sourced from instances.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Hypervisor Instance Network TX Packets per Second | H:

panels.description:
Per-hypervisor aggregate RX bandwidth (Gbit/s) sourced from instances.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Hypervisor Instance Network RX Transmit Gbit/s | H:

panels.description:
Per-hypervisor aggregate TX bandwidth (Gbit/s) sourced from instances.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Hypervisor Instance Network TX Transmit Gbit/s | H:

panels.description:
Per-hypervisor aggregate dropped packets and interface errors sourced from instances (guest NIC counters summed at the hypervisor).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Hypervisor Instance Network Drops & Errors | H:

panels.description:
Conntrack Flows per Hypervisor.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Conntrack Flows per Hypervisor | H:

panels.description:
Conntrack Utilization by Hypervisor.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Conntrack Utilization by Hypervisor | H:
